translation: The people of this world have now been devoured by the dense darkness of this age of Kali and all good activities have gone far away. Thus they are apathetic to the transcendental gems offered by the greatly merciful Lord Gaura.

text: bhāi re bhāi!    gorā guṇa kohone nā jāya
translation: “O my brother! O my brother! No one has told you the glories of Lord Gaura. How great is Lord Brahmā? How great is Lord Śeṣa? They cannot eclipse the greatness of Lord Gaura.

text: chāri veda ṣaḍ-dara-    śana kori adhyayana
vṛthā tāra adhyayana    lochana vihīna jana
translation: “What use are the four Vedas and the six systems of philosophy if one does not worship Lord Gaurāṅga? Why study them? What use is a mirror to a blind man?

text: veda vidyā dui    kichui nā jānata
nayanānanda bhone    sei to sakali jāne
translation: “If one knows the two kinds of Vedic knowledge, he still does not know anything. But if one knows Lord Gaurāṅga, he knows the most precious knowledge. Nayanānanda says: Such a person knows everything. All perfections stay in the palm of his hand.”
